glsa.title: Ruby: Security bypass vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: Ruby is vulnerable to a security bypass of the safe level mechanism.

background.p: Ruby is an interpreted scripting language for quick and easy object-oriented programming. Ruby supports the safe execution of untrusted code using a safe level and taint flag mechanism.

description.p: Dr. Yutaka Oiwa discovered that Ruby fails to properly enforce safe level protections.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code beyond the restrictions specified in each safe level.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Ruby users should upgrade to the latest version:
